doc.after: The house is set in 262-acre (106Â ha) of grounds,[74] which include an 18-acre (7.3Â ha) lake north of the house.[75] The grounds form part of a Registered Historic Park that received a GradeÂ II* listing in 1984. Under this designation are the 25 acres (10Â ha) of early 17th-century formal gardens near the house, the wider 490 acres (200Â ha) medieval park, landscaped from the 17th to the 20th century, with 250 acres (100Â ha) of woodland[76] and buildings including an icehouse and a folly known as Conduit House.[74] Parts of the park have been used for commercial softwood production since the 19th century.[76]
